channel.title: c7041 on Data Science Garage
channel.description: Recent content in c7041 on Data Science Garage

item.title: Lab 01 Graphing 1
item.description: Goals Review some basic graphical formats and when they are useful Make graphs in R, such as histograms, bar charts, box plots, and scatter plots Critique basic graphs to improve readability and accurate communication Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 02 Describing data
item.description: Goals Investigate sampling error; see that larger samples have less sampling error Visualize confidence intervals Calculate basic summary statistics using R Calculate confidence intervals for the mean with R Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 03 Frequency data
item.description: Goals Calculate a confidence interval for a proportion Make a hypothesis test about proportions Fit frequency data to a model Test for a fit to a Poisson distribution Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 04 Contingency Analysis
item.description: Goals Display associations between two categorical variables in contingency tables and mosaic plots Calculate odds ratios and their confidence intervals Test for the independence of two categorical variables Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 05 The Gaussian distribution
item.description: Goals Visualize properties of the Gaussian distribution Understand the Central Limit Theorem Calculate sampling properties of sample means Decide whether a data set likely comes from a Gaussian distribution Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 06 Two Group Tests
item.description: Goals Use strip charts, multiple histograms, and violin plots to view a numerical variable by group Use the paired t-test to test differences between group means with paired data Test for a difference between the means of two groups using the 2-sample t-test Calculate the 95% confidence for a mean difference (paired data) and the difference between means of two groups (2 independent samples of data)

item.title: Lab 07 ANOVA
item.description: Goals Use R to perform analysis of variance (ANOVA) to compare the means of multiple groups Perform Tukey-Kramer tests to look at unplanned contrasts between all pairs of groups Use Kruskal-Wallis tests to test for difference between groups without assumptions of Gaussianity Compare the variances of two groups using Levene’s test Get the data for all labs here

item.title: Lab 08 Correlation and regression
item.description: Goals Calculate a correlation coefficient and the coefficient of determination Test hypotheses about correlation Use the non-parametric Spearman’s correlation Estimate slopes of regressions Test regression models Plot regression lines Examine residual plots for deviations from the assumptions of linear regression Get the data for all labs here Start a script!

item.title: Lab 09 Graphing 2
item.description: Goals Evaluate data using graphical exploration Graph and evaluate frequency distributions Compare frequency distributions Practice good practice in graph design and data exploration Practice {ggplot2} tools and syntax Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 10 Planning your sample size
item.description: Goals Evaluate principles to increase sampling precision in experimental design Evaluate power of sampling Demonstrate power tools in R, like {pwr} Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 11 Linear models
item.description: Goals Load and examine data Fit a linear model to data Evaluate statistical results Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 12 Mixed effects models
item.description: Goals Load and examine data for several mixed effects experimental designs Fit a mixed effects models to data Exaluate the outcome of using random effects in linear models Practice graphingpaired and mixed effects data Evaluate statistical results for linear mixed effects models Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 13 Likelihood
item.description: Goals Explore the calculation of maximum likelihood Perform the log-likelihood ratio test Evaluate statistical results for likelihood test Practice graphical display of likelihood problems Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 14 Generalized linear models
item.description: Goals Fit generalized linear models with R Evaluate GLM assumptions Evaluate statistical and graphical results for GLM Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.

item.title: Lab 15 Model selection
item.description: Goals Compare statistical models using real data Evaluate statistical model fit Use diagnostic information to rank and choose amongst statistical models Get the data for all labs here Start a script! For this and every lab or project, begin by starting a new script, create a good header section and table of contents, save the script file with an informative name, and set your working directory.
